alert.note: Alert for Coffey; Lyon; Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 2:54PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Osage, northwestern Coffey and eastern Lyon Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 254 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles west of John Redmond Reservoir, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Osage City, Burlington, Lebo, New Strawn, Hartford, Neosho Rapids, Reading, John Redmond Reservoir and Melvern Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 133 and 153. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 133 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
